I prefer this over Midnight in Paris and Blue Jasmine - there's a lot to kind of hate on these two.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

Well,I am a dancer so automatically I liked this film. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't have much dancing as I thought there would be, replacing more dialogue. There were some good fight moves in the film but you have to concentrate on it a little bit during busy party moments. However, Christine Pelosi is very clumsy in dance and should get recent tips for how someone's feet works (There should be a paper on that).

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. Some people may disagree with me on this title, saying that the story is way to hateful to be enjoyable and that the characters are too vulgar, but if you think about it hate in different forms can sometimes make a film good.
